p: AS affects human BK polyomavirus (BKPyV) and JC polyomavirus (JCPyV) replication in vitro [ 54, 55]. Both viruses latently and asymptomatically infect the human host and are able to reactivate in immunosuppressed hosts, such as HIV-positive patients or transplant recipients. JCPyV causes a rare and fatal disease known as progressive multifocal leukoencephalopathy (PML), while BKPyV is associated with nephropathy [ 56].
